Cozy Bear, also known as CozyDuke or APT 29, previously hacked the White House, the Department of State and the Joint Chiefs of Staff.

The hackers were able to gain access to the DNC by exploiting what is known in the computer programming world as a “back door,” or computer code that allows an administrator (or hacker) to bypass a computer program’s security features.

While it may seem strange that Russia would have two hacker groups operating independent of each other, the strategy actually follows Russian intelligence trade craft which emphasizes using competing intelligence agencies.
